meanings.definition: A formal written defense or justification of one's beliefs or actions.
meanings.sent1: In her apologia, she explained why she made the decision.
meanings.sent2: The lawyer prepared a detailed apologia for his client's actions.
meanings.sent3: His apologia was so convincing that everyone understood his perspective.
meanings.sent4: The apologia served as a shield against criticism.
meanings.sent5: The apologia eloquently presented his side of the story.

meanings.definition: A speech or piece of writing that defends or explains something.
meanings.sent1: The student delivered an apologia for his project during the presentation.
meanings.sent2: Her apologia clarified the misunderstanding that had arisen.
meanings.sent3: The apologia was so persuasive that it changed people's minds.
meanings.sent4: His apologia was a beacon of reason in a sea of confusion.
meanings.sent5: The apologia skillfully addressed all doubts and questions.
